meanings.definition: The act of directing something to a different place or purpose.
meanings.sent1: She used redirections to guide the lost tourists to the museum.
meanings.sent2: The redirections of traffic during the parade helped maintain order.
meanings.sent3: The redirections of the puzzle pieces made the game more challenging.
meanings.sent4: His redirections of focus towards his goals were admirable.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's redirections of attention kept the students engaged.

meanings.definition: The process of changing the direction of something.
meanings.sent1: The redirections of the river altered the landscape over time.
meanings.sent2: In aviation, redirections of flight paths are common due to weather conditions.
meanings.sent3: The redirections of the soccer ball confused the players on the field.
meanings.sent4: The redirections of thoughts led to a new perspective on the problem.
meanings.sent5: The sudden redirections of wind caught the sailors off guard.

meanings.definition: The act of redirecting a web page to a different URL.
meanings.sent1: Web developers use redirections to ensure users reach the correct page.
meanings.sent2: The website's redirections to related articles improved user experience.
meanings.sent3: The redirections of the online store's homepage surprised the customers.
meanings.sent4: The redirections of online traffic increased the site's visibility.
meanings.sent5: The clever redirections of links led to a higher click-through rate.
